429. According to Trump Administration officials, that’s the number of children in our government’s custody whose parents have been removed from the United States. At our Senate hearing today, officials wouldn’t commit to a deadline to reunify them. That is unacceptable.

During a hearing earlier this morning, we found out there's no new deadline in place to reunify separated children with their parents. This policy has wreaked enough havoc and irreparable harm and this issue demands accountability.

The Trump Administration’s policy of separating children and their parents will likely cause harm to these children for the rest of their lives.
